subtitleNullable: Autism Spectrum Disorder screening test results- All datasets available merged
descriptionNullable:
**Context**
What is Autism
Autism, or autism spectrum disorder (ASD), refers to a broad range of conditions characterized by challenges with social skills, repetitive behaviors, speech, and nonverbal communication.

**Content**
The data used in diagnosing autism includes labeled data related to screening questionnaires, brain MRI images, home videos, etc. Currently, the available and publicly accessible datasets mainly consist of data from screening questionnaires. 
Among the image data, data collected from home videos, genetic data, and data gathered from autism screening questionnaires were selected. 
Four selected datasets were collected from volunteers' responses to Q-Chat-10 and AQ-10. These datasets share several features, including answers to ten questions in binary format (0 and 1), age, ethnicity, and gender. 
Finally, the raw dataset is divided to 4 datasets based on age.
You can check the notebook below in which the raw data is being gathered and divided into age groups:
[https://www.kaggle.com/code/afarinbargrizan/gathered-asd-datasets?scriptVersionId=146464081](url)


**Source**
The dataset was developed by Dr Fadi Fayez Thabtah (fadifayez.com) using a mobile app called ASDTests (ASDtests.com) to screen autism in toddlers.
One of them is collected from AUTISM RESEARCH: the UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS Computer Science Dept to analyze the disease conditions and predict them beforehand

**Applicant**
This data can be used for descriptive and predictive analyses such as classification, clustering, regression, etc. 


Datasets used:
[https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/uppulurimadhuri/dataset](url)
[https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/andrewmvd/autism-screening-on-adults](url)
[https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/fabdelja/autism-screening-for-toddlers](url)
title: ASD questionnairs- Final
